Class GameServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • serverPac.GameServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class GameServer
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Author:
    Daniel Lavigne (664978) Class Description: A server which handles the communication between multiple game players.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Starts the server as an infinite loop. When player connect, they are added to an array list. Once the list contains two players, the list is passed to the ClientHandler class. The list is then emptied. Sends text updates to the server GUI.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • getMsg

        public java.lang.String getMsg()
        A get method so that the observing class can receive new messages from the server class.
        Returns:
        msg - the message String sent to the observer.

      • setMsg

        public void setMsg(java.lang.String msg)
        A set method to set the value of msg.
        Parameters:
        msg - - a message which can be viewed by an observer.
